value.name: Top Tory accused of offering 'VIP lane' for Rishi Sunak's wife's firm in UK
value.description: A Mirror Investigation has revealed details of a meeting between a top Conservative operator and the tech company in which Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata has £624m in shares

value.name: 'Sunak should learn from PPE - there must be no VIP access for wife's family firm'
value.description: The difference is, a wealthy PM must take greater care over any perceived conflicts of interest. That’s where Rishi Sunak falls down. There can be no “VIP access” for the firm responsible for his family fortune. Yet trade minister Lord Johnson ...

value.name: MIDAS SHARE TIPS UPDATE: Our tip Idox is still a vote winner
value.description: Idox is one of the leading players in the field. Working with councils on local and general elections it is expected to play a key role when Prime Minister Rishi Sunak unveils the date for this year's vote. Based in Woking, Surrey, Idox specialises in ...

value.name: Rishi Sunak's warned disposable ban could lead to 'turf wars' by doctors as Australia's anti-vaping laws leads to rise in smoking and gang violence
value.description: The package of proposals, unveiled by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak last week, came after reports the number of children vaping has tripled in three years.

value.name: CITY WHISPERS: Electricity firm Bboxx in shock relocation - to Rwanda
value.description: Bboxx has announced that it will be upping sticks and shifting its global headquarters from London to the capital Kigali.

value.name: Fresh blow to Rishi Sunak as top Tory MP considers running AGAINST his own party in race to be Mayor of London
value.description: PM Rishi Sunak faces a fresh nightmare with one of his own MPs considering running against the Tories for London Mayor. Paul Scully is mulling over standing as an independent after being urged to

value.name: Villagers slam plans for shipping container development next to homes
value.description: Villagers have hit out at plans to install nearly 900 shipping containers next to their homes as part of a new battery storage energy system.

value.name: Schools concrete crisis
value.description: Wales' first minister says building material at centre of schools closures can be maintained. The party wanted access to documents about choices Rishi Sunak made on funding school repairs. Work begun at Sandbach School after RAAC was found in a refectory ...

value.name: Labour vetoes ex-Barclays chief for net zero job after diversity row
value.description: Party claims shortlist of six to be climate watchdog boss ‘lacks credibility’, meaning process could be re-run after general election

value.name: Rishi Sunak says his parents wanted him to speak without an accent to ‘fit in’
value.description: PM says he experienced racism as a child and that his parents sent him for extra drama lessons so that he could ‘speak properly’ Rishi Sunak has spoken about the racism he experienced as a child and how his parents were so determined he should fit in ...

value.name: Pro-Palestine demonstrators promise to march for 'as long as it takes'
value.description: In contrast with the constant flux of the situation in the Middle East - the US airstrikes on Iranian-linked targets the latest example - protesters' demands have remained the same, ever since the first of these marches in October. Ending the war in Gaza, in their view, ends the wider regional conflict.

video.name: Footage shows US strikes and the aftermath

value.name: Police release footage of raid on home in hunt for corrosive substance attack suspect
value.description: “Significant and important pieces of evidence” were recovered in raids at two addresses in east London and three in Newcastle, police said. They include empty containers with corrosive warnings found at one address in Newcastle, which the new footage shows.

video.name: Abdul Ezedi's home raided by police in Newcastle

value.name: UK Orders Crack Down On 'Dirty Money' And 'Counterfeit Goods' Coming From London's American-Style Candy Shops
value.description: Police have seized more than 2,000 unlawful items from an American sweet shop in London, including fake designer products and vapes containing illegal amounts of nicotine.

value.name: Labour ditches radical reforms as it prepares ‘bombproof’ election manifesto
value.description: Plans to reform social care and House of Lords are trimmed as Keir Starmer’s party opts for caution ahead of vote

value.name: A crash course in British politics: How elections work (Week 1)
value.description: This week’s article will explain how British elections work, and hopefully will answer all your related questions.

value.name: More than 100 MPs and peers join call to ban Iranian ‘terrorist’ group
value.description: More than 100 parliamentarians have urged Rishi Sunak to stand up to the Iranian regime’s “belligerence” by proscribing its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as terrorists, as Conservative MPs warned the Prime Minister: “We need a new strategy.”

value.name: Police release footage of raid on address in Abdul Ezedi manhunt
value.description: Police searching for alkali attack suspect Abdul Ezedi have released footage of empty containers with corrosive warnings being found by officers.

value.name: Thousands gather in Edinburgh to call for immediate ceasefire in Gaza
value.description: Thousands of pro-Palestine supporters gathered in Edinburgh on Saturday in support of an immediate ceasefire in Gaza. Carrying Palestinian flags and placards, they marched from Edinburgh Castle down the Royal Mile to the Scottish Parliament, shouting slogans such as: “No Justice, No Peace”, and: “Ceasefire now!”

value.name: Armagh legend’s personal thank you letter from ‘fellow dog lover’ PM Rishi Sunak
value.description: It comes a month after Willie was officially honoured with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s daily Point of Light award for his contributions to charity. Willie has been fundraising for 50 years and has raised over £1 million for charity in that time.
